DOC.brief_summary: Phase I study to define the safety profile and pharmacokinetic parameters of SGN-35 in patients with relapsed/refractory CD30-positive hematologic malignancies. This is a single-arm, open-label, Phase I dose escalation study designed to define the MTD, PK, immunogenicity and anti-tumor activity of SGN-35 in patients with relapsed/refractory CD30-positive hematologic malignancies.
DOC.brief_title: Phase I Open-Label Dose Finding Study of SGN-35 for CD30 Positive Hematologic Malignancies
DOC.criteria: Patients must have histologically confirmed CD30positive hematologic malignancy. Patients with HL must have failed systemic chemotherapy either as induction therapy for advanced stage disease or salvage therapy after initial radiotherapy for early stage disease and were ineligible for, refused treatment by, or previously received stem cell transplant. Patients must have measurable disease of at least 10mm as documented by radiographic technique. Must be at least 18 years of age. Patients with current diagnosis of pcALCL (systemic ALCL eligible). Patients with history of allogeneic stem cell transplant. Patients who have had previous treatment with any antiCD30 antibody.
